etymologies: 1930s: from modern Latin Brucella+ -osis: named after Sir David Bruce (1855–1931), the Scottish physician who identified the bacterium

definitions: a bacterial disease typically affecting cattle and buffalo and causing undulant fever in humans.

notes.text: This disease is caused by Gram-negative bacteria of the genus Brucella, in particular B. abortus

shortDefinitions: bacterial disease affecting cattle and causing undulant fever in humans
